data.title: Bug when adding child game objects in Dualitor
data.body: The recent change to the GameObject<->Scene relationship removed the ability to right click on a game object and add a child game object directly. The child appears at the scene root, and can then be dragged onto the target parent, but this is not a great workflow.

data.title: Resource Hacker Corrupts Lists
data.body:
I've noticed that when using resource hacker to rename types, it frequently corrupts lists, mainly lists of strings, leaving their Count value intact but removing the actual data from them. This results in errors when trying to edit them again and the whole list has to be deleted and readded again to get them to work. I think it is related to the following error generated when doing the renaming:

```
[Core] Error:   Error reading object: NullReferenceException at ArrayNode XmlMetaFormatter.ReadArray(): Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
CallStack:
   at Duality.Serialization.MetaFormat.XmlMetaFormatter.ReadArray() in d:\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\ac4aa965d6134829\Duality\Serialization\MetaFormat\XmlMetaFormatter.cs:line 263
   at Duality.Serialization.MetaFormat.XmlMetaFormatter.ReadObjectBody(DataType dataType) in d:\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\ac4aa965d6134829\Duality\Serialization\MetaFormat\XmlMetaFormatter.cs:line 186
   at Duality.Serialization.XmlFormatterBase.ReadObject(String& objName, Boolean& scopeChanged) in d:\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\ac4aa965d6134829\Duality\Serialization\XmlFormatterBase.cs:line 228
```

data.title: Upgrade OpenTK
data.body:
- The currently used OpenTK version is outdated.
- There are some bugs fixed in the new OpenTK release that aren't in the currently used one.
- Upgrade the OpenTK version used by Duality.
- Also, see [here](http://www.fetzenet.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=182)

data.title: Remove redundant data from Xml Serialization
data.body:
- Right now, there is a lot of redundant data stored in the Xml Serialization data structure, even in the context of a self-descriptive data format.
- In order to make those Xml files more readable to humans, this should change.
- The old format needs to be supported as well, for backwards-compatibility. Only loading, though. Saving can use the fresh, new format.
- In order to pull off some of these changes, switch from using the stream-based XmlReader to the document-based approach using XmlDocument. There is no disadvantage to this change and a lot of code will be much simpler.
  - Keep in mind that Formatters are built around a streamed concept and this still needs to be submitted to.
  - Reading or writing multiple objects sequentially should be entirely possible.
  - Actually, each root call to WriteObject or ReadObject should be considered a "stream-atomic" operation for all Formatters.
    - Write Unit Tests for this behavior.
    - Determine root calls by recursive counter, or just change the Formatter class API to use a public "root" version of these calls and virtual protected non-root versions of it with a different name.
    - Fix BinaryFormatter to properly use BeginOperation / EndOperation regarding this concept.
    - Fix BinaryFormatter to clean its stream data after such operation and also write the header again, etc.
    - Implement the same behavior in the new XmlFormatter.
- All of this needs to be done to both the regular XmlFormatter as well as the XmlMetaFormatter.
## Disclaimer:
- Always keep in mind that redundancy can _only_ be removed, if it exists _within_ the scope of the Xml document itself!
- Removing field types from class / object nodes, because their parent Type could be used to derive them is NOT a valid option, because these can only be derived by reflecting over known Duality Types. This is an information that isn't available based on the Xml document alone and thus shouldn't be considered generally available.
## Proposed changes:
1. **Rejected:** ~~Ignore case sensitivity in boolean values.~~ Obey the default Xml behavior in .Net.
2. **Done:** Remove Array Length parameter and derive dynamically from element count. It will still be allowed as optional parameter. Elements without matching Xml Elements will keep the default value.
3. Child nodes of Arrays shouldn't need to specify their type, as it is already defined implicitly by the parent node.
   1. Don't worry about the parent node not being able to resolve its type. If it doesn't its child nodes won't either anyway - resolving an Array Type is trivial when the base Type is known.
   2. However, child nodes need to be able to override their Type specified implicitly by the Array. This is necessary for polymorphism: Just imagine Component[] or object[].
4. For primitive Arrays, the XmlFormatter may choose to use comma-separated lists instead of child nodes.
   1. This also counts for byte[], but only below a certain length.
   2. However, string and char aren't allowed to do that, because of all the double escaping nightmare. Xml needs to escape strings anyway, but due to internal string processing / splitting / trimming, there would be _another_ layer of escaping. Just don't do that.
5. "surrogate" and "custom" attributes should be synonymous. Only custom should be used in the future.
6. If a "custom" node contains only body or only header, unwrap it. 
   1. To distinguish between them, allow three values for "custom": "none", "body" and "header"
   2. "none" is the same as"false" and "body" is the same as "true".
7. **Rejected:** ~~If a Type or surrogate Type implements a newly created Duality.Serialization.IStringLiteralConvertible method, it should be allowed to be saved and parsed as / from a string literal. This will be useful for never-changing common Types like Vector3 or ColorRGBA.~~ Requires Reflection data to be solvable.
8. **Rejected:** ~~Get rid of the dataType Struct / Class / Array distinction for XML, because this can be derived from the document structure. Simply look for nodes without a "dataType", but with a "type" attribute.~~ Requires Reflection data to be solvable in all cases.
9. **Done:** Change anonymous node name from "object" to something else, because not all of them are actually "objects".
10. When saving an XML, omit the IDs of all objects that are not referenced anywhere.

Wrapping this up: Use the Xml document structure to derive information instead of relying on each node to specify everything itself.
## Ideas how it all might look like:

```
<_items type="System.Single[]" id="715955234">1, 0.75, 0.5, 0</_items>
```

```
<_items type="System.Int32[]" id="715955234">10, 5, 0</_items>
```

```
<_items type="System.String[]" id="715955234">
  <node>Hello World</node>
  <node>This is a "test" string</node>
</_items>
```

```
<pos type="OpenTK.Vector3">0, 100, 500</pos>
```

```
<_items type="Duality.Resources.Pixmap+Layer[]" id="2896774178">
  <node id="3086941652" custom="body">
    <version dataType="Int">3</version>
    <pixelData type="System.Byte[]" id="1420745160">iVBORw0...KGgoAA</pixelData>
  </node>
</_items>
```

```
<identifier type="System.Guid" custom="header">QntHxreDN0ecirNs9q3xqA==</identifier>
```

```
<_items type="System.Guid[]" id="715955234">
  <node custom="header">QntHxreDN0ecirNs9q3xqA==</node>
  <node custom="header">QntHxreDN0ecirNs9q3xqA==</node>
</_items>
```

```
<_items type="OpenTK.Vector2[]" id="715955234">
  <node>10, 17.5</node>
  <node>0.5, 1.5</node>
</_items>
```

data.title: Support for spline Animation
data.body:
- The currently implemented AnimationTrack<T> is hardcoded to do simple linear interpolation between keyframes.
- With the current code design, there is no way of adding other implementations.
- Add more interpolation modes to AnimationTrack via enum and different GetValue implementations.
  - LinearInterpolation
  - SplineInterpolation
- Some of those interpolation modes may require additional GenericOperator shortcut implementations in order to reduce overhead. If they're too obscure, consider implementing those within AnimationTrack<T>.

data.title: dualitor does not save scences in current binary release
data.body: dualitor does not save scences in current binary release (https://www.dropbox.com/s/2tjbdnp6h8foju2/Duality.zip)

data.title: Premultiplied Alpha support

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
- Evaluate whether Premultiplied Alpha could easily be integrated into the existing rendering pipeline. Assumption: This is no big deal.
- Add "Premultiplied" option to Textures as a preprocessing step which can be activated on a per-Texture basis.
- Add "AlphaPremultiplied" DrawTechnique
- Update automated SpriteRenderer creation to honor their Textures Premultiplied option.

data.title: Full Restart on CorePlugin reload with referring EditorPlugin
data.body:
- As mentioned [here](http://www.fetzenet.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=177), there seems to be a problem with triggering a full restart when there is an EditorPlugin referring to a reloading CorePlugin
- The reason may be that references between EditorPlugins and CorePlugins aren't evaluated.
- Check, whether they really aren't and add this.

data.title: Made it possible to lock/hide/unlock nodes in scene view recursively.
Improve the RigidBodyEditor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Add some more tools to the RigidBodyEditor: They could automatically create a matching PolygonShape.
  - Square
  - Triangle
  - etc.
- Also, Return and Escape keys should be properly evaluated during edit operations.

data.title: Child game objects in prefabs appear in the wrong positions when run from the launcher
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

Create a game object and attach a default sprite renderer (any visual component will do for this but this is the easiest). Position the object at 100, 100, 0.
Create a child game object of the first object and attach a sprite renderer to it also.
Move the child to absolute position 200, 200, 0.
Create a prefab from the objects.
Save the scene and run it from the launcher.
The child game object will appear at the wrong position, exactly on top of the parent object.

data.title: Tech demos are missing
data.body:
On the main project page you say "A very good point to start is the GitHub page of Duality where you can find Wiki articles and Downloads like techdemos or the latest binary release."
It seems that there's no wiki (I can live without it, I suppose) and no techdemos (but these I'd really like to have).

data.title: Update Farseer Physics Dependency
data.body:
- Update the existing OpenTK port.
- Keep added events and changed behavior intact.
- Keep settings intact.
- LoopShape is gone - emulate in Duality via ChainShape
- Add ChainShapeInfo to Duality
- Probably a lot of other stuff

data.title: Investigate rare Farseer shutdown failure
data.body:
- Rarely, when shutting down the editor, it fails due to the following exception:

```
[Edit] Error:       An error occurred: NullReferenceException at Void World.ProcessRemovedBodies(): Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
CallStack:
   at FarseerPhysics.Dynamics.World.ProcessRemovedBodies()
   at FarseerPhysics.Dynamics.World.Clear()
   at Duality.Resources.Scene.OnLeaving() in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\Resources\Scene.cs:line 137
   at Duality.Resources.Scene.set_Current(Scene value) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\Resources\Scene.cs:line 82
   at Duality.Resources.Scene.OnDisposing(Boolean manually) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\Resources\Scene.cs:line 796
   at Duality.Resource.Dispose(Boolean manually) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\Resource.cs:line 297
   at Duality.Resource.Dispose() in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\Resource.cs:line 288
   at Duality.DualityApp.OnDiscardPluginData() in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\DualityApp.cs:line 1046
   at Duality.DualityApp.UnloadPlugins() in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\DualityApp.cs:line 856
   at Duality.DualityApp.Terminate(Boolean unexpected) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\DualityApp.cs:line 457
   at Duality.DualityApp.Terminate() in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\Duality\DualityApp.cs:line 424
   at DualityEditor.DualityEditorApp.Terminate(Boolean byUser) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\DualityEditor\DualityEditorApp.cs:line 305
   at DualityEditor.Forms.MainForm.OnFormClosing(FormClosingEventArgs e) in C:\Stuff\work\duality\master\DualityEditor\Forms\MainForm.cs:line 354
   at System.Windows.Forms.Form.WmClose(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Form.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
```
- Investigate this failure and fix possible causes.

data.title: UndoRedo doesn't work in BatchInfoPropertyEditor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- To reproduce, simply define a custom shader and DrawTechnique and use it in a Material.
- UndoRedo steps will show up for editing uniforms, but they don't actually do anything.

data.title: Added a right click context menu to the scene editor to place the select...
data.body: ...ed objects at the cursor.

data.title: Fixed Scene.FindComponent<T>() so that it forwards the activeOnly flag t...
data.body: ...o Scene.FindComponent()

data.title: Broken Picking with multiple CamViews
data.body: See here: http://www.fetzenet.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=146

data.title: Required Components
data.body: Not sure if this is intended functionality or a bug, but if you add a required component to a script, game objects that already have that script do not get the new required component added to them. It would be nice if they did

data.title: Windows 8.1 and Visual Studio 2013 Compatibily!
data.body: If possible, Thank's, I wil rebuild the Editor and The Launcher on Visual Studio 2013!

data.title: Moving "Open Sourcecode" toolbar button away from "Save" button
data.body:
It happens often that I mistakenly click "Open Sourcecode" while in a rush to click on the Save button, with the effect of opening a new VS instance that take a while to start and then have to be closed.

Maybe the toolbar could be reordered as
Save | Sandbox Controls | Run / Debug | Open Sourcecode?

data.title: DockPanel windows are no longer dockable
data.body:
Hi Adam

To reproduce this, open Project View for example, and pull it away from the main Duality window so that it is floating, then try and drag the window around. DockPanel used to draw a drag preview rectangle of where the window will go when the mouse is released. It no longer does that. Additionally, the dock icons no longer appear, so it's impossible to re-dock a window that's been detached. 

Another problem that is potentially related is that we're getting pretty bad performance now when dragging objects around inside the editor when any treeview window is open, and the treeview contains a reasonably large number of nodes. Profiling suggests that the tree view is refreshing every time a MoveCamViewObjAction runs, and the result is that objects don't physically appear to move until the mouse stops moving. We think these problems started happening around the same time.

Thanks

data.title: Unable to start DualityEditor.exe under Windows 8.1 Preview
data.body:
The DualityEditor.exe is unable to run under Windows 8.1 preview (Pro 64bit). It was running fine on Windows 8.

The splash screen was shown but nothing happen after that.

data.title: Crash in Windows Vista
data.body:
- Due to the exception-unsafe usage of Windows 7 Desktop integration code, the editor may crash on Windows Vista. This should be fixed.
- See [here](http://www.fetzenet.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=128)

data.title: Audio Glitches when streaming multiple Sounds at once
data.body:
- Streaming multiple Sounds at the same time can lead to audible glitches in some cases.
- Determine the cause of the problem and fix it
  - It's not OpenAL Soft, the bug also occurs without using it.
  - The sources are not running out of buffers to process, it seems.
  - NVorbis TestApp doesn't seem to have that kind of problem. What is it doing differently?
    - Uses a single Thread for all streaming
    - ?

data.title: Add a NumericSliderPropertyEditor for user comfort
data.body:
Problem:
- Lots of numeric properties have a fixed or semi-fixed range and don't need exact adjustment.
- Using a text-editor to enter numeric values is counter-intuitive in this case.

Solution:
- Add a NumericSliderPropertyEditor that is automatically chosen instead of the NumericPropertyEditor whenever suitable.
  - How to determine "suitable"?
  - [EditorHintRange] is insufficient alone, because it only covers fixed ranges, not "reasonable" ranges. Should be used to determine absolute min/max values, though.
  - Manually hint that a slider would be nice? Could be just a hint flag ("hardcoded") or introducing a new hint type that mentions a preferred kind of PropertyEditor.
- Such PropertyEditor doesn't need to be limited to fixed value ranges. Adding an extend range knob on each side and deriving start range from current values could make this editor very flexible.
- It should still display the chosen value and allow editing it using a text field.

data.title: Allow a Sound to carry multiple AudioData references
data.body:
Problem:
- Some sounds may exist in multiple versions, just to add some variety.
- The game doesn't care, which one of them exactly is played.
- In the current Duality version, this can only be achieved by having multiple Sounds, each referring to their own AudioData, and programmatically deciding which to play.

Solution:
- A far more comfortable solution would be to allow a Sound to have multiple AudioDatas referenced by a single Sound, one reference per variation.
- When playing the Sound, which AudioData is actually chosen will be determined upon initializing the SoundInstance.
- Each of those AudioData items could be assigned a probability that is used for a weighted random descision.

Additional notes:
- The EditorAction and ConvertOp to create a Sound from AudioData should be extended to allow packing multiple AudioData Resources into a single Sound. Only do so if some kind of naming scheme is apparant.

data.title: Add event for custom ContentProvider.ResourceResolve handlers
data.body:
- For procedural content, it should be possible to resolve ContentRefs dynamically.
- Such handler could be invoked, if no matching content is registered and no matching file exists.
- If a Resource can be retrieved using this handler, it will be automatically registered using the specified ContentRef path.

data.title: Improve Plugin Reload
data.body:
- Currently, any file change to plugin dll files is considered to be a valid reason for a reload.
- This introduces a lot of unnecessary reloads, which can negatively impact usability if those reloads happen to require a full editor restart.
  - Dependency / Non-Leaf plugins
  - Editor plugins
- Prevent unnecessary reloads!
  - Only reload if file size or any byte of the file differs.
  - All equal? Don't reload.
